meanings.definition: Matsahs: unleavened bread traditionally eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, we always have matsahs with our meal.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother bakes delicious matsahs for the holiday.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped the matsahs on the floor, and my dog thought it was a treat!
meanings.sent4: The matsahs on the table looked like golden discs of history.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked matsahs filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: Matsahs: plural form of matsah, a type of flat, unleavened bread.
meanings.sent1: The store sells different brands of matsahs for Passover.
meanings.sent2: We bought a box of matsahs to share with our friends.
meanings.sent3: My brother ate all the matsahs in one sitting - he must really love them!
meanings.sent4: The matsahs lined up on the plate like soldiers ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The children enjoyed making matsahs in Sunday school.

meanings.definition: Matsahs: the act of eating matsah during the Passover holiday.
meanings.sent1: The family gathered around the table for the matsahs ceremony.
meanings.sent2: I look forward to the matsahs feast every year.
meanings.sent3: My sister challenged me to a matsahs-eating contest - it was hilarious!
meanings.sent4: The joy of matsahs filled the room with warmth and tradition.
meanings.sent5: The sound of crunching matsahs echoed through the dining room.
